p: Intraperitoneal infection of BALB/c mice with a high dose (1 × 10 8 pfu) of WSN induced 40% mortality ( Figures 1E,F). In a previous study, intraperitoneal infection of BALB/c mice with a low dose (5 × 10 6 pfu) of WSN had a protective effect against subsequent intraperitoneal infection with a high dose (1 × 10 8 pfu) of H3N2, a dose that was fatal in previously uninfected mice ( Gautam et al., 2019). We performed a similar experiment in which we first infected mice intraperitoneally with 5 × 10 6 pfu H3N2 and then infected them intranasally with a potentially lethal dose (1 × 10 5 pfu) WSN. The results showed that the low-dose intraperitoneal infection with H3N2 had a protective effect against subsequent lethal-dose intranasal infection with WSN ( Figures 1G,H).
